content:
TITLE: Downloading and Extracting Drupal Package via Curl and Unzip
DESCRIPTION: Commands to download a specific version of Drupal using curl, extract it with unzip, navigate to the directory, and run the quick-start script to immediately set up a development instance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -sS https://ftp.drupal.org/files/projects/drupal-x.y.z.zip --output drupal-x.y.z.zip
unzip drupal-x.y.z.zip
cd /path/to/drupal-x.y.z
php core/scripts/drupal quick-start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running PHPUnit Test Suites in Drupal
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run specific PHPUnit test suites in Drupal, such as unit, functional, or functional-javascript. These can be combined with groups and filters for more targeted testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/tests/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
./vendor/bin/phpunit -c /path/to/your/phpunit.xml --testsuite unit
./vendor/bin/phpunit -c /path/to/your/phpunit.xml --testsuite functional,functional-javascript
./vendor/bin/phpunit -c /path/to/your/phpunit.xml --testsuite build --group Composer
./vendor/bin/phpunit -c /path/to/your/phpunit.xml --testsuite build --exclude-group Build
./vendor/bin/phpunit -c /path/to/your/phpunit.xml --testsuite unit --filter ClassTest::testMethod
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Schema for User Roles in Drupal
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the schema for the 'users_roles' table in Drupal. It establishes the relationship between users and their assigned roles, including primary and foreign key constraints.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/modules/system/tests/fixtures/HtaccessTest/access_test.php-info.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
$schema['users_roles'] = [
  'description' => 'Maps users to roles.',
  'fields' => [
    'uid' => [
      'description' => 'Primary Key: {users}.uid for user.',
      'type' => 'int',
      'unsigned' => TRUE,
      'not null' => TRUE,
      'default' => 0,
    ],
    'rid' => [
      'description' => 'Primary Key: {role}.rid for role.',
      'type' => 'varchar_ascii',
      'length' => 64,
      'not null' => TRUE,
    ],
  ],
  'primary key' => ['uid', 'rid'],
  'indexes' => [
    'rid' => ['rid'],
  ],
  'foreign keys' => [
    'user' => [
      'table' => 'users',
      'columns' => ['uid' => 'uid'],
    ],
  ],
];
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating New Drupal Project with Composer
DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new Drupal project using the recommended project template with Composer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/composer/Template/README.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
composer -n create-project drupal/recommended-project my-project
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Drupal Dependencies with Composer
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Drupal's dependencies using Composer, which should be run from the Drupal web root directory after downloading Drupal.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
composer install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining a Drupal Form in PHP
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to define a form in Drupal using PHP. It shows the proper class structure and method implementation for a form builder.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/modules/migrate_drupal_ui/tests/src/Functional/d7/files/sites/default/private/Babylon5.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
class ExampleForm extends FormBase {
  /**
   * {@inheritdoc}
   */
  public function getFormId() {
    return 'example_form';
  }

  /**
   * {@inheritdoc}
   */
  public function buildForm(array $form, FormStateInterface $form_state) {
    $form['name'] = [
      '#type' => 'textfield',
      '#title' => $this->t('Name'),
      '#required' => TRUE,
    ];
    return $form;
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing a Drupal Hook
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to implement a Drupal hook function. It follows the naming conventions and includes a documentation block explaining the hook's purpose.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/modules/migrate_drupal_ui/tests/src/Functional/d7/files/sites/default/private/Babylon5.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
/**
 * Implements hook_help().
 */
function mymodule_help($route_name, RouteMatchInterface $route_match) {
  switch ($route_name) {
    case 'help.page.mymodule':
      return t('This is the help text for my module.');
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Granting Database Privileges for Drupal User
DESCRIPTION: SQL command to grant necessary privileges to the Drupal database user. This includes SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, CREATE, DROP, INDEX, ALTER, and CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES privileges on the specified database.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.mysql.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: SQL
CODE:
```
GRANT SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, CREATE, DROP, INDEX, ALTER,
CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES ON database_name.*
TO 'username'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'password';
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running PHPUnit Tests in Drupal
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run PHPUnit tests in Drupal, including running a single test class, listing test groups, and running all tests in a specific group. The commands use the PHPUnit executable located in the vendor directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/tests/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
./vendor/bin/phpunit -c /path/to/your/phpunit.xml path/to/your/class/file.php
./vendor/bin/phpunit --list-groups
./vendor/bin/phpunit -c /path/to/your/phpunit.xml --group group_name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Modules to Drupal Project
DESCRIPTION: Command to add new modules to a Drupal project using Composer require, demonstrated with the Devel module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/composer/Template/README.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
composer require drupal/devel:^1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Post-Installation Security Permissions
DESCRIPTION: Commands to secure the settings.php file and sites/default directory after completing the Drupal installation process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
chmod go-w sites/default/settings.php
chmod go-w sites/default
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Nightwatch Tests in Drupal
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run Nightwatch tests in Drupal, including running all tests, core tests only, skipping core tests, running a single test, and running accessibility tests for different themes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/tests/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn test:nightwatch --env local
yarn test:nightwatch --tag core
yarn test:nightwatch --skiptags core
yarn test:nightwatch tests/Drupal/Nightwatch/Tests/loginTest.js
yarn test:nightwatch --tag a11y
yarn test:nightwatch --tag a11y:admin
yarn test:nightwatch --tag a11y:default
yarn test:nightwatch --tag a11y:default --defaultTheme olivero
yarn test:nightwatch --tag a11y:admin --adminTheme claro
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Moving Drupal Files to Installation Directory
DESCRIPTION: Command to move all Drupal files, including hidden files, to the desired installation location within your web server's document root.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mv drupal-x.y.z/* drupal-x.y.z/.htaccess drupal-x.y.z/.csslintrc drupal-x.y.z/.editorconfig drupal-x.y.z/.eslintignore drupal-x.y.z/.eslintrc.json drupal-x.y.z/.gitattributes /path/to/your/installation
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Drupal Core Development Dependencies with Composer
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Drupal core development dependencies using Composer in the Drupal root directory. These dependencies are necessary for running tests but should not be installed on a production site.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/tests/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
composer install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Post-scaffold Command for Patching
DESCRIPTION: Example of a Composer script that applies a patch to a scaffold file after it's been copied to the destination.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/composer/Plugin/Scaffold/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"post-drupal-scaffold-cmd": [
  "cd docroot && patch -p1 <../patches/htaccess-ssl.patch"
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating MySQL Database for Drupal
DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new MySQL database for Drupal installation. Requires a MySQL user with CREATE privilege.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.mysql.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: SQL
CODE:
```
mysqladmin -u username -p create database_name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running PHPUnit Tests with Web Server User Permissions
DESCRIPTION: Command to run PHPUnit tests using the web server user's permissions, which can help resolve file permission issues during test execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/tests/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo -u www-data ./vendor/bin/phpunit -c /path/to/your/phpunit.xml --group group_name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying SQLite Database File Path in Drupal Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows an example path for the SQLite database file in Drupal's configuration. It suggests placing the file in a location within the Drupal directory structure that can be protected from direct web access.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.sqlite.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
sites/default/files/.ht.sqlite
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Chromedriver for JavaScript Tests in Drupal
DESCRIPTION: Command to start Chromedriver on port 4444, which is necessary for running JavaScript tests based on the WebDriverTestBase class in Drupal.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/tests/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
/path/to/chromedriver --port=4444
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Drupal Core Only
DESCRIPTION: Command to update only Drupal core and its dependencies without affecting other modules or themes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/composer/Template/README.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
composer update drupal/core-recommended --with-dependencies
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Drupal Quick-Start Help Command
DESCRIPTION: Command to display available options for the Drupal quick-start script, useful for configuring the installation process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
php core/scripts/drupal quick-start --help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating PostgreSQL User for Drupal
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a new PostgreSQL user for Drupal with specific permissions. It creates a user named 'username' with a password prompt, encrypts the password, and sets no additional role or database creation privileges.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.pgsql.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
createuser --pwprompt --encrypted --no-createrole --no-createdb username
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating and Configuring Drupal Settings File
DESCRIPTION: Commands to copy the default settings file template and set appropriate permissions for the installation process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cp sites/default/default.settings.php sites/default/settings.php
chmod a+w sites/default/settings.php
# After installation
chmod go-w sites/default/settings.php
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running PHPUnit Tests for the Version Component in Drupal
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to run PHPUnit tests specifically for the Version component in Drupal. It uses the -c flag to specify the configuration file and the --group flag to target only tests in the Version test group.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/lib/Drupal/Component/Version/TESTING.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ ./vendor/bin/phpunit -c core --group Version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Copying example.sites.php for Multisite Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Command to create sites.php from the example file, which is required for multisite functionality in Drupal. This file helps Drupal map domain names to specific site configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ cp sites/example.sites.php sites/sites.php
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Logging into MySQL for Drupal Database Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Command to log into MySQL to set up database access rights for Drupal.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.mysql.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: SQL
CODE:
```
mysql -u username -p
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Custom Schema for Drupal in PostgreSQL
DESCRIPTION: This SQL command creates a custom schema for Drupal and grants authorization to the Drupal database user. This is an optional advanced step that allows Drupal to run in a specific schema other than the default 'public' schema.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.pgsql.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
CREATE SCHEMA schema_name AUTHORIZATION username;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Drupal Scaffolding Tests with Custom Fixture Directory
DESCRIPTION: This bash command demonstrates how to set a custom directory for scaffolding fixtures and run the unit tests. It also shows how to manually execute the scaffolding process for testing purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/tests/Drupal/Tests/Composer/Plugin/Scaffold/fixtures/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ SCAFFOLD_FIXTURE_DIR=$HOME/tmp/scaffold-fixtures composer unit
$ cd $HOME/tmp/scaffold-fixtures
$ cd drupal-drupal
$ composer drupal:scaffold
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Web Root Location in Composer JSON
DESCRIPTION: This JSON configuration defines the location of the web root for the Drupal project, which is essential for proper scaffolding of files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/composer/Plugin/Scaffold/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "name": "my/project",
  "extra": {
    "drupal-scaffold": {
      "locations": {
        "web-root": "./docroot"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Uploads Directory with Write Permissions in Unix/Linux
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a new directory named 'uploads' and grant write permissions to it, which can be used as an alternative file system path for Drupal uploads.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mkdir uploads
chmod a+w uploads
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running PHPUnit Tests for Specific Drupal Component Groups
DESCRIPTION: Command for running PHPUnit tests for a specific component group (in this example, the Render group) using the Drupal core configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/lib/Drupal/Component/Render/TESTING.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ ./vendor/bin/phpunit -c core --group Render
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Scaffold File Mapping in Composer JSON
DESCRIPTION: This configuration defines the mapping of scaffold files from their source location to the destination in the project structure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/composer/Plugin/Scaffold/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "name": "drupal/assets",
  "extra": {
    "drupal-scaffold": {
      "file-mapping": {
        "[web-root]/robots.txt": "assets/robots.txt"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting File Permissions in Drupal's settings.php
DESCRIPTION: PHP code snippet to set file permissions in Drupal's settings.php or local.settings.php file, which can help resolve permission problems after running tests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/tests/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
$settings['file_chmod_directory'] = 02775;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Drupal Assets Package with Scaffold Mappings
DESCRIPTION: Example composer.json for a package that provides scaffold files for Drupal, with a comprehensive file-mapping configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/composer/Plugin/Scaffold/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "name": "drupal/assets",
  "extra": {
    "drupal-scaffold": {
      "file-mapping": {
        "[web-root]/.csslintrc": "assets/.csslintrc",
        "[web-root]/.editorconfig": "assets/.editorconfig",
        "[web-root]/.eslintignore": "assets/.eslintignore",
        "[web-root]/.eslintrc.json": "assets/.eslintrc.json",
        "[web-root]/.gitattributes": "assets/.gitattributes",
        "[web-root]/.ht.router.php": "assets/.ht.router.php",
        "[web-root]/.htaccess": "assets/.htaccess",
        "[web-root]/sites/default/default.services.yml": "assets/default.services.yml",
        "[web-root]/sites/default/default.settings.php": "assets/default.settings.php",
        "[web-root]/sites/example.settings.local.php": "assets/example.settings.local.php",
        "[web-root]/sites/example.sites.php": "assets/example.sites.php",
        "[web-root]/index.php": "assets/index.php",
        "[web-root]/robots.txt": "assets/robots.txt",
        "[web-root]/update.php": "assets/update.php",
      }
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running PHPUnit Tests for the Drupal Graph Component
DESCRIPTION: This command executes PHPUnit tests specifically for the Graph component. It uses the configuration file in the core directory and filters tests by the 'Graph' group annotation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/lib/Drupal/Component/Graph/TESTING.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ ./vendor/bin/phpunit -c core --group Graph
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Custom Package Cleanup in composer.json
DESCRIPTION: Example configuration to specify custom directories to be removed from specific packages. This uses the 'extra' field in composer.json to define which directories should be removed from the vendor/package directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/composer/Plugin/VendorHardening/README.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"extra": {
  "drupal-core-vendor-hardening": {
    "vendor/package": ["test", "documentation"]
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring User-Agent Permissions in Drupal's robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: This configuration specifies which files and directories web crawlers are allowed to access and which ones are disallowed. It permits crawling of essential assets (CSS, JS, images) while preventing access to administrative areas, sensitive files, and user operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/assets/scaffold/files/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
# CSS, JS, Images
Allow: /core/*.css$
Allow: /core/*.css?
Allow: /core/*.js$
Allow: /core/*.js?
Allow: /core/*.gif
Allow: /core/*.jpg
Allow: /core/*.jpeg
Allow: /core/*.png
Allow: /core/*.svg
Allow: /profiles/*.css$
Allow: /profiles/*.css?
Allow: /profiles/*.js$
Allow: /profiles/*.js?
Allow: /profiles/*.gif
Allow: /profiles/*.jpg
Allow: /profiles/*.jpeg
Allow: /profiles/*.png
Allow: /profiles/*.svg
# Directories
Disallow: /core/
Disallow: /profiles/
# Files
Disallow: /README.md
Disallow: /composer/Metapackage/README.txt
Disallow: /composer/Plugin/ProjectMessage/README.md
Disallow: /composer/Plugin/Scaffold/README.md
Disallow: /composer/Plugin/VendorHardening/README.txt
Disallow: /composer/Template/README.txt
Disallow: /modules/README.txt
Disallow: /sites/README.txt
Disallow: /themes/README.txt
# Paths (clean URLs)
Disallow: /admin/
Disallow: /comment/reply/
Disallow: /filter/tips
Disallow: /node/add/
Disallow: /search/
Disallow: /user/register
Disallow: /user/password
Disallow: /user/login
Disallow: /user/logout
Disallow: /media/oembed
Disallow: /*/media/oembed
# Paths (no clean URLs)
Disallow: /index.php/admin/
Disallow: /index.php/comment/reply/
Disallow: /index.php/filter/tips
Disallow: /index.php/node/add/
Disallow: /index.php/search/
Disallow: /index.php/user/password
Disallow: /index.php/user/register
Disallow: /index.php/user/login
Disallow: /index.php/user/logout
Disallow: /index.php/media/oembed
Disallow: /index.php/*/media/oembed
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Directory Permissions During Installation
DESCRIPTION: Commands to grant write permissions to the sites/default directory so the installer can create necessary files, and then restoring restricted permissions after installation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
chmod a+w sites/default
# After installation
chmod go-w sites/default
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running PHPUnit Tests for Drupal DependencyInjection Component
DESCRIPTION: Command to run PHPUnit tests specifically for the DependencyInjection component. The command uses vendor/bin/phpunit with the core configuration and filters tests using the DependencyInjection test group.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/lib/Drupal/Component/DependencyInjection/TESTING.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ ./vendor/bin/phpunit -c core --group DependencyInjection
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading and Extracting Drupal via Wget and Tar
DESCRIPTION: Commands to download a specific version of Drupal using wget and extract it using tar on Unix/Linux systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
wget https://www.drupal.org/files/projects/drupal-x.y.z.tar.gz
tar -zxvf drupal-x.y.z.tar.gz
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating the Files Directory for Drupal
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create the public files storage directory and set appropriate write permissions, which is required for Drupal installation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mkdir sites/default/files
chmod a+w sites/default/files
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Uncommenting File Public Path in settings.php
DESCRIPTION: Configuration line to uncomment in settings.php to modify the public file system path in Drupal. This controls where Drupal stores uploaded files accessible to the public.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/INSTALL.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
# $settings['file_public_path'] = 'sites/default/files';
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Lando for Drupal Development Environment
DESCRIPTION: A complete Lando configuration for setting up a Drupal development environment with PHP, MySQL, Mailhog for email testing, and Node.js. It defines services, environment variables, port mappings, and custom tooling commands for development tasks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/modules/migrate_drupal_ui/tests/src/Functional/d7/files/sites/default/files/ds9.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
name: drupal
recipe: drupal9
config:
  php: '8.1'
  via: apache
  webroot: web
  database: mysql:5.7
  xdebug: false
  config:
    php: .lando/php.ini
services:
  appserver:
    overrides:
      environment:
        # Use the correct path for Drush commands.
        DRUSH_OPTIONS_URI: "https://drupal.lndo.site"
        SIMPLETEST_BASE_URL: "https://drupal.lndo.site"
        SIMPLETEST_DB: "mysql://drupal9:drupal9@database/drupal9"
        X_SIMPLETEST_SCRIPT_DIR: "/app/web/core/vendor/bin/"
  database:
    creds:
      user: drupal9
      password: drupal9
      database: drupal9
  mailhog:
    type: mailhog
    portforward: true
    hogfrom:
      - appserver
  node:
    type: node:16
    globals:
      gulp-cli: "latest"
tooling:
  drush:
    service: appserver
    cmd: /app/vendor/bin/drush
  node:
    service: node
  npm:
    service: node
  gulp:
    service: node
  yarn:

  phpunit:
    cmd:

  phpcs:
    cmd:
      - appserver: cd /app && php vendor/bin/phpcs
  phpcbf:
    cmd:
      - appserver: cd /app && php vendor/bin/phpcbf
  eslint:
    cmd:

  stylelint:
```

TITLE: Defining InstallProfile Interface for Drupal Installation Profiles in PHP
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines the InstallProfile interface in PHP. It extends ContainerInjectionInterface and specifies methods that must be implemented by installation profile classes, including setName(), getName(), and getExcludedInstallTasks().
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/modules/system/tests/fixtures/IgnoreDirectories/frontend_framework/b.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
<?php

namespace Drupal\Core\Installer;

use Symfony\Component\DependencyInjection\ContainerInterface;

/**
 * Defines a common interface for installation profiles.
 */
interface InstallProfile extends ContainerInjectionInterface {

  /**
   * Sets the name of the installation profile.
   *
   * @param string $name
   *   The name of the installation profile.
   */
  public function setName($name);

  /**
   * Gets the name of the installation profile.
   *
   * @return string
   *   The name of the installation profile.
   */
  public function getName();

  /**
   * Gets the installation tasks to exclude.
   *
   * @return string[]
   *   An array of installation tasks to exclude.
   */
  public function getExcludedInstallTasks();

}
```

TITLE: Rendering Content Entity Template in Drupal Twig
DESCRIPTION: This Twig template defines the structure for rendering a content entity in Drupal. It includes handling for entity title, content rendering, and attributes. The template provides a basic structure that can be extended for specific entity types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/tests/Drupal/Tests/Composer/Plugin/Scaffold/fixtures/empty-file/assets/empty_file.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: twig
CODE:
```
{#
/**
 * @file
 * Default theme implementation to present a content entity.
 *
 * Available variables:
 * - title: The title of the entity.
 * - content: The content rendered through the EntityViewBuilder.
 * - attributes: HTML attributes for the containing element.
 * - entity: The full entity, for context.
 * - entity_type: The entity type.
 * - bundle: The bundle.
 * - view_mode: The view mode identifier.
 *
 * @see template_preprocess_content_entity()
 *
 * @ingroup themeable
 */
#}
<article{{ attributes }}>
  {% if title %}
    <h1>{{ title }}</h1>
  {% endif %}
  {% if content %}
    {{- content -}}
  {% endif %}
</article>

```

TITLE: Defining Schema for User Data in Drupal

```
$schema['users'] = [
  'description' => 'The base table for users.',
  'fields' => [
    'uid' => [
      'description' => 'Primary Key: Unique user ID.',
      'type' => 'int',
      'unsigned' => TRUE,
      'not null' => TRUE,
    ],
    'uuid' => [
      'description' => 'Unique Key: Universally unique identifier for this entity.',
      'type' => 'varchar_ascii',
      'length' => 128,
      'not null' => TRUE,
    ],
    'langcode' => [
      'description' => 'The {language}.langcode of the original variant of this user.',
      'type' => 'varchar_ascii',
      'length' => 12,
      'not null' => TRUE,
      'default' => '',
    ],
  ],
  'primary key' => ['uid'],
  'unique keys' => [
    'user_uuid' => ['uuid'],
  ],
];

$schema['users_field_data'] = [
  'description' => 'The base table for user entities.',
  'fields' => [
    'uid' => [
      'description' => 'The {users}.uid this record affects.',
      'type' => 'int',
      'unsigned' => TRUE,
      'not null' => TRUE,
      'default' => 0,
    ],
    'langcode' => [
      'description' => 'The {language}.langcode of this variant.',
      'type' => 'varchar_ascii',
      'length' => 12,
      'not null' => TRUE,
      'default' => '',
    ],
    'preferred_langcode' => [
      'description' => 'The {language}.langcode preferred by the user.',
      'type' => 'varchar_ascii',
      'length' => 12,
      'not null' => TRUE,
      'default' => '',
    ],
    'preferred_admin_langcode' => [
      'description' => 'The {language}.langcode preferred by the user for administration pages.',
      'type' => 'varchar_ascii',
      'length' => 12,
      'not null' => TRUE,
      'default' => '',
    ],
    'name' => [
      'description' => 'The name of this user.',
      'type' => 'varchar_ascii',
      'length' => USERNAME_MAX_LENGTH,
      'not null' => TRUE,
      'default' => '',
    ],
    'pass' => [
      'description' => "The user's password (hashed).",
      'type' => 'varchar',
      'length' => 255,
      'not null' => TRUE,
      'default' => '',
    ],
    'mail' => [
      'description' => "The user's email address.",
      'type' => 'varchar',
      'length' => 254,
      'not null' => FALSE,
      'default' => '',
    ],
    'timezone' => [
      'description' => 'The timezone of this user.',
      'type' => 'varchar',
      'length' => 32,
      'not null' => FALSE,
    ],
    'status' => [
      'description' => 'Whether the user is active(1) or blocked(0).',
      'type' => 'int',
      'not null' => TRUE,
      'default' => 0,
      'size' => 'tiny',
    ],
    'created' => [
      'description' => 'Timestamp for when user was created.',
      'type' => 'int',
      'not null' => TRUE,
      'default' => 0,
    ],
    'changed' => [
      'description' => 'Timestamp for when user was changed.',
      'type' => 'int',
      'not null' => TRUE,
      'default' => 0,
    ],
    'access' => [
      'description' => 'Timestamp for previous time user accessed the site.',
      'type' => 'int',
      'not null' => TRUE,
      'default' => 0,
    ],
    'login' => [
      'description' => "Timestamp for user's last login.",
      'type' => 'int',
      'not null' => TRUE,
      'default' => 0,
    ],
    'init' => [
      'description' => 'Email address used for initial account creation.',
      'type' => 'varchar',
      'length' => 254,
      'not null' => FALSE,
      'default' => '',
    ],
  ],
  'primary key' => ['uid', 'langcode'],
  'indexes' => [
    'user_access' => ['access'],
    'user_changed' => ['changed'],
    'user_created' => ['created'],
    'user_mail' => ['mail'],
  ],
  'foreign keys' => [
    'uid_base' => [
      'table' => 'users',
      'columns' => ['uid' => 'uid'],
    ],
  ],
];
```

TITLE: Implementing Drush Batch Test Command 1 in PHP

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
 * Implementation of command 'test-batch-1'
 */
function drush_batch_test_test_batch_1() {
  $batch = array(
    'operations' => array(
      array('_batch_test_callback_1', array()),
    ),
  );
  batch_set($batch);
  drush_backend_batch_process();
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Recoverable Error Batch Callback in PHP
DESCRIPTION: This callback function simulates a batch operation that causes a recoverable error. It intentionally throws a recoverable exception to test how Drush handles this type of error.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/modules/system/tests/fixtures/IgnoreDirectories/a.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
 * Batch callback for batch 2.
 */
function _batch_test_callback_2($context) {
  throw new drush_exception('DRUSH_RECOVERABLE_ERROR', dt('Expected recoverable error during batch 2'));
  drush_log(dt('Done with batch 2'), 'success');
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Drush Commands for Testing Batch Operations in PHP
DESCRIPTION: This code defines custom Drush commands that test batch operations in Drupal. It includes commands to perform batch operations that will either succeed or fail intentionally for testing purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/modules/system/tests/fixtures/IgnoreDirectories/a.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

/**
 * @file
 * Test file for drush unit tests.
 */

/**
 * Implementation of hook_drush_command().
 */
function batch_test_drush_command() {
  $items = array();

  $items['test-batch-1'] = array(
    'description' => 'Test batch 1: Successful batch operation.'
  );
  $items['test-batch-2'] = array(
    'description' => 'Test batch 2: Batch operation that triggers recoverable error.'
  );
  $items['test-batch-3'] = array(
    'description' => 'Test batch 3: Batch operation that triggers a non-recoverable error.'
  );
  $items['test-batch-4'] = array(
    'description' => 'Test batch 4: Batch operation that forces a batch error.'
  );

  return $items;
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Forced Batch Error Callback in PHP
DESCRIPTION: This callback function forces a batch error by setting the 'error' element in the batch result array. It tests how Drush handles explicitly signaled batch failures.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drupal/drupal/blob/11.x/core/modules/system/tests/fixtures/IgnoreDirectories/a.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
 * Batch callback for batch 4.
 */
function _batch_test_callback_4($context) {
  $context['results']['batch_test'] = TRUE;
  $context['error_message'] = 'Expected error during batch 4';
  drush_log(dt('Done with batch 4'), 'success');
}
```
